Posts.Content: Dear momwithkids;Steve]. I hope that I can help you in someway with my info. Itook At the beginning of the treatment  the doc gave me 3 tablets in the morning  and 4 in the afternoon[each tablet 500mg]. I was very tired and my feet very sore, so he reduce the dose  to 3 and 3, altogether 6=3000mg. I tolerate xeloda reasonable well, feel a bit tired towards end of cycle ,but my feet are the ones that give me a hard time as  a side effect of this drug is the foot and hand syndrome. Itreat this with a variety of things... Ihad only once chemo[taxol and avastin] after that the doc put me into this drug, every 3 weeks I have blood tests to check how I am going. I have breast cancer, secondary to bones, no pain .Steve  I am happy to interchange info. Best wishes, j13
Posts.Title: Anybody on Xeloda? Any advice?

Posts.Content: I have been with Xeloda for nearly two years, mainly only one side effect hand and foot syndrome. For me only my feet. I have discovered that when they are red, sore and sometimes with cracks to put  them to soak in cold icy water, with oats[you make your own little bag with an old pantyhose], for about 20 min, even 3 times a  day if they are very sore, you will see an improvement. The skin becomes soft and pale, almost normal your walking  improves too. good luck! J. 13

Posts.Content: Dear  Jodie;Ihave breast cancer secondary to the bones. I am taking xeloda for nearly 2 years. Xeloda is a good drug, some people have a few side effects but me , my main problem is my feet [sore , red, peeling at times] which at times makes my walking difficult, I am fortunate not to have any other complaint. I had only once chemo, and that terrified me. Can you please tell me about oyur herceptin? How are you feeling? Try to find inner peace somehow to enjoy each day. My best wishes. This journey is more difficult if you are all alone. I hope this will help you.J13
Posts.Title: Anybody on Xeloda? Any advice?

Posts.Content: Ihave been taking Xeloda for nearly 2  years, in general well tolerated with the exception on my feet[red ,hot dry, small cuts, sore]. I have tried for this condition wool fat cream, udder cream, and cloranphenicol cream for the cuts,and icy water to bring temperature down. Still difficult to walk for longer periods when they are sore...any suggestions? special tips? eager to know...
